Package main.java.Talkbox.musicplayer

Class MusicPlayer

  • java.lang.Object
    • main.java.Talkbox.musicplayer.MusicPlayer
  • public class MusicPlayer
extends java.lang.Object
    Class for streaming music within a Java program. Works for .wav formats only.
    Version:
    January 12th 2019
    Author:
    jordan

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field Description
      static int LOOP
      Mode to loop the track over and over.
      static int PLAY_ONCE
      Mode to play the track only once.

      MusicPlayer​(java.io.File file)
      Constructs the MusicPlayer using an external file.
      MusicPlayer​(java.lang.String path)
      Constructs the MusicPlayer using an internal path.

      • MusicPlayer

        public MusicPlayer​(java.io.File file)
        Constructs the MusicPlayer using an external file.
        Parameters:
        file - - the audio file to be played back.

      • MusicPlayer

        public MusicPlayer​(java.lang.String path)
        Constructs the MusicPlayer using an internal path. Note that the path starts from the package of this class.
        Parameters:
        path - - the path to the audio file to be played back.

    • Method Detail

      • skip

        public void skip​(int minutes,
                 int seconds)
        Skips the given time in minutes and seconds within the track.
        Parameters:
        minutes - - the minutes within the track.
        seconds - - the seconds within the track.

      • skip

        public void skip​(java.lang.String time)
        Skips the amount of time specified by the given string. Does nothing if the amount of time exceeds the length of the track.
        Parameters:
        time -

      • reset

        public void reset()
        Stops the music player if it is still playing, then resets the music player to begin from the beginning of the track.

      • stop

        public void stop()
        Stops the playback of the music player.

        Begins playback of the music player.

        public java.lang.String framesToTime​(long frames)
        Converts the number of frames specified into a string time.
        Parameters:

        Returns:
